Translations.Text: And if We show them mercy and free them of the distress they have, they would still blindly continue with their transgressions
And We did certainly punish them, but they did not become humble towards their Lord, nor do they submit
Until when We open upon them a door to severe punishment, they are despaired
And He it is Who gave you the ears and the eyes and the minds. You thank but little
And He it is Who multiplied you on the earth, and to Him you shall be gathered
And He it is Who gives life and causes death. And alternation of the night and the day is His handiwork. Do you not then understand
But they say the like of what the earlier peoples said
They say, "Are we certain to be raised again to life when we are dead and become dust and bones
This promise given to us now was also certainly given to our forefathers. These are nothing but stories of the ancients
Ask, "Whose — if you know — is the earth, and whose is whatever therein
They will say, "Allah's." Ask, "Why do you not remember [and worship Him alone] then
Ask, "Who is the Lord of the seven heavens and the Lord of the mighty Throne
They will say, "Allah's." Ask, "Will you not then take heed of Him
Ask, "Who is it in Whose hand is the absolute control of all things and Who shelters, but Who needs none to shelter Him, if you do but know
They will say, "Allah." Ask, "How then are you deluded into worshipping someone/thing other than Him
But We have brought them the Truth, and certainly indeed they are lying

Never did Allah take to Himself a son, and never was there with him any other god! In that case every god would certainly have taken away what he created. And they would certainly have tried to overpower one another. Glorified is Allah above what they attribute to Him
The Knower of the unseen and the seen, He is exalted far above what they worship other than Him
Say, "My Lord! If You should make me see what they are warned against
My Lord, place me not then with the wicked people
And We can certainly indeed make you see what We warn them against
Dispel evil with what is good! We do know what they say
And say, "My Lord! I seek refuge in You against satanic promptings
And I seek refuge in You, my Lord, lest they approach me
Wicked people continue with their misdeeds until when death comes to one of them, he says, "My Lord! Send me back
So that I may do good deeds in what I have left behind." Nay! It is just a wishful utterance that he makes. And before them is a barrier until the day they are raised
So when the trumpet is blown on the Resurrection Day, there shall be no ties of relationship between them, nor shall they ask of one another
Then all those are the successful ones who are heavy with good deeds
And those that are light in good deeds are the ones who have doomed themselves to live in Hell
The fire shall scorch their faces, and their lips therein shall be distorted in pain
Were not My Verses/signs recited to you and you rejected them
They would say, "Our Lord! It was our misfortune that made us a people gone astray
Our Lord! Take us out of it. And if we return to evil ways as before, then we shall indeed be doing wrong
The Lord shall say, "Get doomed therein! And speak to Me not
There was indeed a group of My subjects who said, `Our Lord! We do believe. So forgive us and have mercy on us. And You are the Best Bestower of mercies
But you held them so much in ridicule that you forgot to remember Me. And you continued laughing at them
Because they were patient, I have indeed rewarded them by making them (— and not you —) the winners this Day
The Lord would ask, "How many years did you stay in the earth
They would say, "We stayed a day or part of a day. We are not sure. So ask those who keep count
The Lord would say, "You did stay but a little — had you but known it
Did you then think that We had created you as an idle pursuit and that you shall not be returned to Us
So, exalted is Allah, the True Sovereign! There is no god but He, the Lord of the noble Throne

And he who prays to Allah, as also to another god besides Him, does have no evidence of any such god existing. So his case rests with his Lord only. The suppressors of the Truth shall indeed not succeed
And say, "Forgive, my Lord, and have mercy! And You are the best Bestower of mercies
